answers.answer: O he weighed 3lbs 2 oz on was 16 inches long.  He had a lil problem with jaundice and had to be under that blue light...dont know the name ...for 4 days.  He had a little fluid at the time of birth on the back of his head but ut i got re absorbed and there was no swelling.  He had a tough start as his apgar scores were 1 at first then at 5 min they were also 1 then at 10 min the were 4. :(  Later they told me they didnt think he would make it at first but he pulled through!!

Congrats! I just wanted to tell you grunting is a sign of respiratory distress. I'm a nurse in a maternity unit and we get scared when we hear any grunting. I would take him in. I suppose if your doctor said it's ok that's ok..... Just wanted to let you know. That pushing, grunting thing is a sign baby is not getting enough oxygen. I wish you the best congrats! Sorry I don't mean to scare you, just let someone know.
OMG!! Okay.. we will  take him in.  i was afraid of something like that.  It's like im paranoid now and afraid of that SIDS thing. Thanks for your response!!

congratulations! your story sounds so much like mine, except that i had all of it happen at 36 weeks, so they delivered right away. the symptoms you describe are identical to what mine were except my protein was +4. i am surprised they induced you. at 36 weeks my dr decided not to induce and go straight to the c-section because he said that being that early, it was likely i wouldn't progress and would need the c-sec anyways. by then i felt so awful i didn't think i'd be able to go through labor anyways. i was falling asleep on my way to the operating room.i'm so glad your ds is doing so well! my dd also grunts a lot, but she always ends up farting or pooping. i can't relate to him pooping once a week, since dd still poops about 8-10 times a day!!! but she is solely on breast milk, so i think that's why. enjoy your little miracle!!!

Wow, I am happy that things are going well for your family now!  Congrats on your little miracle!  I know that had to be really freightening, I know my emergency c-section at 39 weeks was terrifying.  Keep us posted on how he's doing.... and personally, with having a BM once a week seems a little drastic, even for a preemie and a month old.  I would certainly take him in and get a second opinion.

Congratulations!  I am a mom to Ian (born at 34w0d with no respiratory problems, but feeding problems) and also to Isaac (born at 34w5d with severe respiratory problems, but no feeding problems).  Both of them grunted, but Ian was the biggest grunter.  My pediatrician said that premiees especially grunt alot, even after RDS.

My baby was born at 35 weeks. She grunted a lot and was very fussy when she was about one month old and my ped said that is a sign of acid reflux. She started on prevacid and stopped grunting. Just a thought.

question: Well hi ladies!!  Its been awhile since i have been here.  I hope everyone is doing well and having healthy pregnancies!!  Well i had my beautiful baby boy on August 5th due to severe preeclampsia.  I went in for a follow up routine appointment on Aug 2nd ,as my doc had suspected that i was getting preeclampsia at a previous appointment, and was admitted to the the hospital that day.  I had +3 protein in my urine and my blood pressure was 164/90 and it's normally in the 120's.  Anyways they got in a panic and started asking me had i had headaches, blurred vision or anything and i was like no just really bad swelling which was obvious.  I also had gained 14 lbs in 3 weeks and then another 7 in one week which was out of the norm for me because i was on a slow weight gain since my second trimester.  My doc told me that it's best that they take the baby within the next week and that i would need to get started on the 2 dose steroid shots for my sons lungs.  I was transported by ambulance to OU medical center and treated as high risk where they immediately started me on magnesium for my blood pressure.  My husband and i was so scared but we were also content at the fact we were at the best hospital for this situation so we prayed and prepared ourselves for a long road.  i was on complete bed rest because of the magnesium and my blood pressure was not getting any lower.  My baby was doing well but my health was at stake.  I had a throbbing headache that wouldn't go away and thats when the doc started to induce labor.  i was put on pitocin and after a while they put this little balloon thing in my cervix to open it up.  Sorry i dont know what it's called!!lol  Anyway i started to dialate and contractions started after they broke my water at 5 cm.  My doc told me that there was little to no progress and that my labor might had stalled and that we may have to do a c section.  well i really wanted a vaginal but i wanted whats best for my baby.  He wasnt taking the contractions well and at each contraction his heart rate would go down so they pulled the plug and rushed me in for a c section.  All went well there but as my baby came out i could feel the tension in the room.  I didnt get to see him as he was swarmed with neonatal docs.   I could see the fear in my husbands eyeas as they asked him to leave and i was overcome with emotion.  My baby pulled through!!  Thank God.  He had a rough start but all is well now!  he spent 2 weeks in the Nicu and suprised all the nurses at his progress.  Once he was able to bottle feed it was no holding him back.  He truly is my lil angel.  He came home on the 20th of august and is doing so well.  The only thing is this, i have been bottle and breastfeeding and he seems to be constipated.  His doc says he's not and that he should poop once a week.  But when he was in the nicu i was feeding him the same and he was going everyday.  I mean is that normal.  he grunts a lot..sorry if that sound stupid but are one month olds supposed to grunt alot.  I thought that was a sign of him being constipated or maby something was wrong.  he acts as if he's pushing but nothing comes out! His face turns all red and he whines after that. And once again his doc say thats normal.  i dont know maby it is but has anyone else had this?  here a link to my page to see my baby!!  Good luck to u all!! bye   http://www.i-am-pregnant.com/vip/dallasgyrl
title: I delivered @ 33 weeks!! My birth story and a quick question!!
